Text: Guido Coen (1915–2010) was an Italian-born British film producer and film subtitler.
Triplets:<Guido Coen
1:
<Text: Guido Coen:  He and his family were interned in Douglas on the Isle of Man during the Second World War.>
Triplets:<Guido Coen
2:
--------------------
<Text: Guido Coen:  He began his career working for Filippo Del Giudice and Two Cities Films.>
Triplets:<Guido Coen
3:
ere are the triplets extracted from the text:

<Guido Coen
4:
--------------------
Text: Guido Coen:  As Coen later described it in an interview, he did not know anything about subtitling at the time, and learned on the job: I finally got a phone call from London Films, Sir Cunnyngham, that 's it, who asked me whether I had ever subtitles pictures.
Triplets:<Guido Coen
5:
--------------------
Text: Guido Coen:  I immediately said I had when in point of fact I did not know what he meant, and there was a young man in the office with Sir David Cunnynghame called Lew Watt, and he said Lew Watt will do the technical side and we want you to subtitle an Italian picture in to English.
Triplets:<Guido Coen
8:
--------------------
<Text: Guido Coen:  And I started subtitling pictures with Lew Watt, I used to do the literary side, and he used to do the technical side, the spotting, and lengths, and we together did subtitles for 40 or 50 pictures.>
Triplets:<Guido Coen
9:
ere are the extracted triplets:

<The funny thing was
10:
--------------------
<Text: Guido Coen:  We had the film, we had the print which used to run on the two sided thing.>
Triplets:<Guido Coen
11:
--------------------
Text: Guido Coen:  And Lew Watt was working all the day so we had to do this at night, so we either used to work at night till 2 o'clock in the morning or we used to work at the weekends.
Triplets:<Guido Coen

<Text: Guido Coen:  And that was how we started.Coen later founded his own company Kenilworth Film Productions and spent most of the post-war years producing second features.>
Triplets:<Guido Coen
14:
--------------------
Text: Guido Coen:  He made a dozen films in partnership with the director Charles Saunders.
